title: Slow Cooker Beef Neck Bones and Gravy

Ingredients.1: 0.5 pounds beef neck bones, or more to taste

Directions.2: Clean neck bones and remove any excess fat. Season bones with cumin, allspice, black pepper, red pepper flakes, and salt; dust with 1/4 cup flour.

Directions.3: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir garlic until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Increase heat to medium-high and add seasoned neck bones; cook until bones begin to brown, about 1 minute per side.

Directions.4: Transfer neck bones and drippings to the preheated slow cooker; add beef broth and onion.

Directions.5: Cook on High for 1 hour. Reduce heat to Low and cook 4 to 6 hours.

Directions.6: Transfer neck bones to a dish. Sprinkle remaining flour into the slow cooker and stir well. Return neck bones to slow cooker. Let stand until gravy thickens, 15 to 20 minutes.
